title: Hapoel Ashdod F.C.
text:
<a href="Hapoel">Hapoel</a> Ashdod F.C. () is an Israeli <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Ashdod">Ashdod</a>. In 1999, it merged with local rivals <a href="Maccabi%20Ironi%20Ashdod%20F.C.">Ironi Ashdod</a> to create <a href="F.C.%20Ashdod">F.C. Ashdod</a>.
In 2015, the club was resurrected by its fans.
History.
Original club.
The club was founded in 1957 and reached the second tier after winning <a href="Liga%20Bet">Liga Bet</a> South B Division in the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Liga%20Bet">1970–71 season</a>. After several lower-table finishes, the club was relegated to <a href="Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a> at the end of the <a href="1978%E2%80%9379%20Liga%20Artzit">1978–79 season</a>, in which they finished bottom. They returned to the second division at the end of the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Liga%20Alef">1989–90 season</a>, in which they won the southern division of Liga Alef, beating local rivals <a href="Maccabi%20Ironi%20Ashdod%20F.C.">Maccabi Ironi Ashdod</a> to the title by a single point. They narrowly avoiding relegation in <a href="1993%E2%80%9394%20Liga%20Artzit">1993–94</a>, when they finished one place above the relegation zone, but after several more lower-table finishes, in <a href="1997%E2%80%9398%20Liga%20Artzit">1997–98</a> the club finished third, one place below promotion to the top division, but the <a href="1998%E2%80%9399%20Liga%20Artzit">following season</a> finished tenth, and were due to be relegated two divisions due to financial problems. However, the club merged with Maccabi Ironi Ashdod, to form <a href="F.C.%20Ashdod">F.C. Ashdod</a>.
In 2001 a new club, Hapoel Namal Ashdod was established, playing in <a href="Liga%20Gimel">Liga Gimel</a>. Although the club was initially successful, winning its division and gaining promotion to Liga Bet, at the end of the <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20Liga%20Bet">2003–04 season</a>, in which it finished fourth, it was disbanded.
Re-established club.
In March 2015, fans of Hapoel Ashdod gathered and re-established the club, with the purpose of joining <a href="Liga%20Gimel">Liga Gimel</a> in the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20in%20Israeli%20football">2015–16 season</a>.
Later on that month, <a href="F.C.%20Ashdod">F.C. Ashdod's</a> chairman, <a href="Jacky%20Ben-Zaken">Jacky Ben-Zaken</a>, decided to rename F.C. Ashdod to Hapoel Ashdod and to play in red shirts, following a dispute with fans of the previous club, <a href="Maccabi%20Ironi%20Ashdod%20F.C.">Maccabi Ironi Ashdod</a>. Despite warnings from the <a href="Israel%20Football%20Association">Israel Football Association</a>, which informed the club that such changes during season are illegal, F.C. Ashdod did show up for their <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Israeli%20Premier%20League%23Bottom%20Playoff">Bottom playoff</a> match against <a href="Hapoel%20Ra%27anana%20A.F.C.">Hapoel Ra'anana</a> in red shirts, with the caption "F.C. Hapoel Ashdod", and was eventually disciplined. However, Hapoel Ashdod fans have decided that the club will be registered in Liga Gimel, rather than joining forces with Ben-Zaken's F.C. Ashdod.
At the same time, another group of Hapoel Ashdod fans, headed by lawyer Ya'akov Shitrit, formed a second club, due to play in <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Liga%20Gimel">2015–16 Liga Gimel</a>. As Shitrit's group was affiliated with the <a href="Hapoel">Hapoel</a> organization, this club was registered in the <a href="Israel%20Football%20Association">IFA</a> under the name <a href="Hapoel%20Bnei%20Ashdod%20F.C.">Hapoel Bnei Ashdod</a> (Hebrew:הפועל בני אשדוד), while the fans' club was forced to drop the name Hapoel from their club and registered under the name of <a href="Agudat%20Sport%20Ashdod%20F.C.">Agudat Sport Ashdod</a> (Hebrew: אגודת ספורט אשדוד), (or in short Hebrew: א.ס. אשדוד, Aleph Samekh Ashdod, lit. A.S. Ashdod).
On 18 September 2015 the club played it first official match, beating <a href="F.C.%20Tzeirei%20al-Hoshla">F.C. Tzeirei al-Hoshla</a> 6–0 in the first round of the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Israel%20State%20Cup">State Cup</a>. The club's first manager, former <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a> player <a href="Moris%20Zano">Moris Zano</a> led the club through its first matches, but was fired in October 2015. In December 2015, the club signed <a href="Pini%20Balili">Pini Balili</a> as its new manager.
